description: A spectrum of new technologies enable the layering of interactions and information the digital world onto the physical world, creating spaces in which users interact with their physical surroundings through digital media. This course explores the intersection of the relationship between media, social interaction, and information systems for the urban environment. Examples include applications of location-awareness and pervasive gaming. Students will be exposed to literature from the social sciences on social networks and democratic engagement and will work toward the design of public art installations, applications for mediated urbanism, or games and applications that afford social and civic engagement.
name: DIGITAL MEDIA & THE CITY
